get.description: Retrieve a single record by its ID with options to specify field projections and output format.

schema.description: If you want to get only some fields, pass in this parameter, otherwise all visible fields will be obtained, The parameter value depends on the specified fieldKeyType to determine whether it is name or id
Define the return value formate, you can set it to text if you only need simple string value
Define the key type of record.fields[key], You can click "systemInfo" in the field edit box to get fieldId or enter the table design screen with all the field details

get.description: Retrieve a list of records with support for filtering, sorting, grouping, and pagination. The response includes record data and optional group information.

schema.description: If you want to get only some fields, pass in this parameter, otherwise all visible fields will be obtained, The parameter value depends on the specified fieldKeyType to determine whether it is name or id
Define the return value formate, you can set it to text if you only need simple string value
Define the key type of record.fields[key], You can click "systemInfo" in the field edit box to get fieldId or enter the table design screen with all the field details

schema.description: Set the view you want to fetch, default is first view. result will filter and sort by view options.
When a viewId is specified, configure this to true will ignore the view's filter, sort, etc
A filter object for complex query conditions based on fields, operators, and values. Use our visual query builder at https://app.teable.ai/developer/tool/query-builder to build filters.
Search for records that match the specified field and value

Filter out the records that can be selected by a given link cell from the relational table. For example, if the specified field is one to many or one to one relationship, recordId for which the field has already been selected will not appear.

Filter out selected records based on this link cell from the relational table. Note that viewId, filter, and orderBy will not take effect in this case because selected records has it own order. Ignoring recordId gets all the selected records for the field
Filter selected records by record ids
An array of sort objects that specifies how the records should be ordered.
An array of group objects that specifies how the records should be grouped.
An array of group ids that specifies which groups are collapsed
When provided, other query parameters will be merged with the saved ones.
The record count you want to take, maximum is 2000
The records count you want to skip

options.description: The configuration options of the field. The structure of the field's options depend on the field's type.

persistedAsGeneratedColumn.description: Whether this formula field is persisted as a generated column in the database. When true, the field value is computed and stored as a database generated column.

hasOrderColumn.description: Whether this link field has an order column for maintaining insertion order. When true, the field uses a separate order column to preserve the order of linked records.

meta.description: The metadata of the field. The structure of the field's meta depend on the field's type. Currently formula and link fields have meta.

prompt.description:
The prompt to use for the AI operation, use {fieldId} to reference the field in the table, example: "Summarize the content of {fieldId} into 100 words"
But if your reference field is attachment, do not reference it here, just put it in attachmentFieldIds the AI will known it

aiConfig.description: The AI configuration of the field.

isLookup.description: Whether this field is lookup field. witch means cellValue and [fieldType] is looked up from the linked table.

isConditionalLookup.description: Whether this lookup field applies a conditional filter when resolving linked records.

baseId.description: the base id of the table that this field is linked to, only required for cross base link

relationship.description: describe the relationship from this table to the foreign table

foreignTableId.description: the table this field is linked to

lookupFieldId.description: the field in the foreign table that will be displayed as the current field

fkHostTableName.description: the table name for storing keys, in many-to-many relationships, keys are stored in a separate intermediate table; in other relationships, keys are stored on one side as needed

selfKeyName.description: the name of the field that stores the current table primary key

foreignKeyName.description: The name of the field that stores the foreign table primary key

filter.description: A filter object for complex query conditions based on fields, operators, and values. Use our visual query builder at https://app.teable.ai/developer/tool/query-builder to build filters.

linkFieldId.description: The id of Linked record field to use for lookup

baseId.description: the base id of the table that this field is linked to, only required for cross base link

foreignTableId.description: the table this field is linked to

lookupFieldId.description: the field in the foreign table that will be displayed as the current field

filter.description: Filter to apply when resolving conditional lookup values.

fieldId.description: The field in the foreign table used to order lookup records.

order.description: Ordering direction to apply to the sorted field.

sort.description: Optional sort configuration applied before aggregating lookup values.

limit.description: Maximum number of matching records to include in the lookup result.

notNull.description: Whether this field is not null.

unique.description: Whether this field is not unique.

isPrimary.description: Whether this field is primary field.

isComputed.description: Whether this field is computed field, you can not modify cellValue in computed field.

isPending.description: Whether this field's calculation is pending.

hasError.description: Whether This field has a configuration error. Check the fields referenced by this field's formula or configuration.

cellValueType.description: The cell value type of the field.

isMultipleCellValue.description: Whether this field has multiple cell value.

dbFieldType.description: The field type of database that cellValue really store.

dbFieldName.description: Field(column) name in backend database. Limitation: 1-63 characters, can only contain letters, numbers and underscore, case sensitive, cannot be duplicated with existing db field name in the table.

recordRead.description: Field record read permission. When set to false, reading records is denied. When true or not set, reading records is allowed.

recordCreate.description: Field record create permission. When set to false, creating records is denied. When true or not set, creating records is allowed.

options.description: The configuration options of the field. The structure of the field's options depend on the field's type.

persistedAsGeneratedColumn.description: Whether this formula field is persisted as a generated column in the database. When true, the field value is computed and stored as a database generated column.

hasOrderColumn.description: Whether this link field has an order column for maintaining insertion order. When true, the field uses a separate order column to preserve the order of linked records.

meta.description: The metadata of the field. The structure of the field's meta depend on the field's type. Currently formula and link fields have meta.

prompt.description:
The prompt to use for the AI operation, use {fieldId} to reference the field in the table, example: "Summarize the content of {fieldId} into 100 words"
But if your reference field is attachment, do not reference it here, just put it in attachmentFieldIds the AI will known it

aiConfig.description: The AI configuration of the field.

isLookup.description: Whether this field is lookup field. witch means cellValue and [fieldType] is looked up from the linked table.

isConditionalLookup.description: Whether this lookup field applies a conditional filter when resolving linked records.

baseId.description: the base id of the table that this field is linked to, only required for cross base link

relationship.description: describe the relationship from this table to the foreign table

foreignTableId.description: the table this field is linked to

filter.description: A filter object for complex query conditions based on fields, operators, and values. Use our visual query builder at https://app.teable.ai/developer/tool/query-builder to build filters.

linkFieldId.description: The id of Linked record field to use for lookup

baseId.description: the base id of the table that this field is linked to, only required for cross base link

foreignTableId.description: the table this field is linked to

lookupFieldId.description: the field in the foreign table that will be displayed as the current field

filter.description: Filter to apply when resolving conditional lookup values.

fieldId.description: The field in the foreign table used to order lookup records.

order.description: Ordering direction to apply to the sorted field.

sort.description: Optional sort configuration applied before aggregating lookup values.

limit.description: Maximum number of matching records to include in the lookup result.

notNull.description: Whether this field is not null.

unique.description: Whether this field is not unique.

isPrimary.description: Whether this field is primary field.

isComputed.description: Whether this field is computed field, you can not modify cellValue in computed field.

isPending.description: Whether this field's calculation is pending.

hasError.description: Whether This field has a configuration error. Check the fields referenced by this field's formula or configuration.

cellValueType.description: The cell value type of the field.

isMultipleCellValue.description: Whether this field has multiple cell value.

dbFieldType.description: The field type of database that cellValue really store.

dbFieldName.description: Field(column) name in backend database. Limitation: 1-63 characters, can only contain letters, numbers and underscore, case sensitive, cannot be duplicated with existing db field name in the table.

recordRead.description: Field record read permission. When set to false, reading records is denied. When true or not set, reading records is allowed.

recordCreate.description: Field record create permission. When set to false, creating records is denied. When true or not set, creating records is allowed.

get.description: Retrieve a list of fields in a table with optional filtering

schema.description: The id of the view.
If you want to get only some fields, pass in this parameter, otherwise all visible fields will be obtained

options.description: The configuration options of the field. The structure of the field's options depend on the field's type.

persistedAsGeneratedColumn.description: Whether this formula field is persisted as a generated column in the database. When true, the field value is computed and stored as a database generated column.

hasOrderColumn.description: Whether this link field has an order column for maintaining insertion order. When true, the field uses a separate order column to preserve the order of linked records.

meta.description: The metadata of the field. The structure of the field's meta depend on the field's type. Currently formula and link fields have meta.

prompt.description:
The prompt to use for the AI operation, use {fieldId} to reference the field in the table, example: "Summarize the content of {fieldId} into 100 words"
But if your reference field is attachment, do not reference it here, just put it in attachmentFieldIds the AI will known it

aiConfig.description: The AI configuration of the field.

isLookup.description: Whether this field is lookup field. witch means cellValue and [fieldType] is looked up from the linked table.

isConditionalLookup.description: Whether this lookup field applies a conditional filter when resolving linked records.

baseId.description: the base id of the table that this field is linked to, only required for cross base link

relationship.description: describe the relationship from this table to the foreign table

foreignTableId.description: the table this field is linked to

lookupFieldId.description: the field in the foreign table that will be displayed as the current field

fkHostTableName.description: the table name for storing keys, in many-to-many relationships, keys are stored in a separate intermediate table; in other relationships, keys are stored on one side as needed

selfKeyName.description: the name of the field that stores the current table primary key

foreignKeyName.description: The name of the field that stores the foreign table primary key

filter.description: A filter object for complex query conditions based on fields, operators, and values. Use our visual query builder at https://app.teable.ai/developer/tool/query-builder to build filters.

linkFieldId.description: The id of Linked record field to use for lookup

baseId.description: the base id of the table that this field is linked to, only required for cross base link

foreignTableId.description: the table this field is linked to

lookupFieldId.description: the field in the foreign table that will be displayed as the current field

filter.description: Filter to apply when resolving conditional lookup values.

fieldId.description: The field in the foreign table used to order lookup records.

order.description: Ordering direction to apply to the sorted field.

sort.description: Optional sort configuration applied before aggregating lookup values.

limit.description: Maximum number of matching records to include in the lookup result.

notNull.description: Whether this field is not null.

unique.description: Whether this field is not unique.

isPrimary.description: Whether this field is primary field.

isComputed.description: Whether this field is computed field, you can not modify cellValue in computed field.

isPending.description: Whether this field's calculation is pending.

hasError.description: Whether This field has a configuration error. Check the fields referenced by this field's formula or configuration.

cellValueType.description: The cell value type of the field.

isMultipleCellValue.description: Whether this field has multiple cell value.

dbFieldType.description: The field type of database that cellValue really store.

dbFieldName.description: Field(column) name in backend database. Limitation: 1-63 characters, can only contain letters, numbers and underscore, case sensitive, cannot be duplicated with existing db field name in the table.

recordRead.description: Field record read permission. When set to false, reading records is denied. When true or not set, reading records is allowed.

recordCreate.description: Field record create permission. When set to false, creating records is denied. When true or not set, creating records is allowed.

options.description: The configuration options of the field. The structure of the field's options depend on the field's type.

persistedAsGeneratedColumn.description: Whether this formula field is persisted as a generated column in the database. When true, the field value is computed and stored as a database generated column.

hasOrderColumn.description: Whether this link field has an order column for maintaining insertion order. When true, the field uses a separate order column to preserve the order of linked records.

meta.description: The metadata of the field. The structure of the field's meta depend on the field's type. Currently formula and link fields have meta.

prompt.description:
The prompt to use for the AI operation, use {fieldId} to reference the field in the table, example: "Summarize the content of {fieldId} into 100 words"
But if your reference field is attachment, do not reference it here, just put it in attachmentFieldIds the AI will known it

aiConfig.description: The AI configuration of the field.

isLookup.description: Whether this field is lookup field. witch means cellValue and [fieldType] is looked up from the linked table.

isConditionalLookup.description: Whether this lookup field applies a conditional filter when resolving linked records.

baseId.description: the base id of the table that this field is linked to, only required for cross base link

relationship.description: describe the relationship from this table to the foreign table

foreignTableId.description: the table this field is linked to

lookupFieldId.description: the field in the foreign table that will be displayed as the current field

fkHostTableName.description: the table name for storing keys, in many-to-many relationships, keys are stored in a separate intermediate table; in other relationships, keys are stored on one side as needed

selfKeyName.description: the name of the field that stores the current table primary key

foreignKeyName.description: The name of the field that stores the foreign table primary key

filter.description: A filter object for complex query conditions based on fields, operators, and values. Use our visual query builder at https://app.teable.ai/developer/tool/query-builder to build filters.

linkFieldId.description: The id of Linked record field to use for lookup

baseId.description: the base id of the table that this field is linked to, only required for cross base link

foreignTableId.description: the table this field is linked to

lookupFieldId.description: the field in the foreign table that will be displayed as the current field

filter.description: Filter to apply when resolving conditional lookup values.

fieldId.description: The field in the foreign table used to order lookup records.

order.description: Ordering direction to apply to the sorted field.

sort.description: Optional sort configuration applied before aggregating lookup values.

limit.description: Maximum number of matching records to include in the lookup result.

notNull.description: Whether this field is not null.

unique.description: Whether this field is not unique.

isPrimary.description: Whether this field is primary field.

isComputed.description: Whether this field is computed field, you can not modify cellValue in computed field.

isPending.description: Whether this field's calculation is pending.

hasError.description: Whether This field has a configuration error. Check the fields referenced by this field's formula or configuration.

cellValueType.description: The cell value type of the field.

isMultipleCellValue.description: Whether this field has multiple cell value.

dbFieldType.description: The field type of database that cellValue really store.

dbFieldName.description: Field(column) name in backend database. Limitation: 1-63 characters, can only contain letters, numbers and underscore, case sensitive, cannot be duplicated with existing db field name in the table.

recordRead.description: Field record read permission. When set to false, reading records is denied. When true or not set, reading records is allowed.

recordCreate.description: Field record create permission. When set to false, creating records is denied. When true or not set, creating records is allowed.

get.description: Getting associated records for a view filter configuration.

200.description: Returns the view to filter the configured records.

get.description: Retrieve associated records that match the view filter configuration for a linked field

200.description: Returns the link field to filter the configured records.

post.description: Automatically generate suggestions for filling a specific field

viewId.description: Set the view you want to fetch, default is first view. result will filter and sort by view options.

filter.description: A filter object for complex query conditions based on fields, operators, and values. Use our visual query builder at https://app.teable.ai/developer/tool/query-builder to build filters.

orderBy.description: An array of sort objects that specifies how the records should be ordered.

groupBy.description: An array of group objects that specifies how the records should be grouped.

ignoreViewQuery.description: When a viewId is specified, configure this to true will ignore the view's filter, sort, etc

200.description: Returns the task ID for the auto-fill process

A filter object for complex query conditions based on fields, operators, and values. Use our visual query builder at https://app.teable.ai/developer/tool/query-builder to build filters.
Search for records that match the specified field and value

Filter out the records that can be selected by a given link cell from the relational table. For example, if the specified field is one to many or one to one relationship, recordId for which the field has already been selected will not appear.

Filter out selected records based on this link cell from the relational table. Note that viewId, filter, and orderBy will not take effect in this case because selected records has it own order. Ignoring recordId gets all the selected records for the field
Filter selected records by record ids
An array of sort objects that specifies how the records should be ordered.
An array of group objects that specifies how the records should be grouped.
An array of group ids that specifies which groups are collapsed
When provided, other query parameters will be merged with the saved ones.
If you want to get only some fields, pass in this parameter, otherwise all visible fields will be obtained
The parameter "ranges" is used to represent the coordinates [column, row][] of a selected range in a table.
Types of non-contiguous selections

A filter object for complex query conditions based on fields, operators, and values. Use our visual query builder at https://app.teable.ai/developer/tool/query-builder to build filters.
Search for records that match the specified field and value

Filter out the records that can be selected by a given link cell from the relational table. For example, if the specified field is one to many or one to one relationship, recordId for which the field has already been selected will not appear.

Filter out selected records based on this link cell from the relational table. Note that viewId, filter, and orderBy will not take effect in this case because selected records has it own order. Ignoring recordId gets all the selected records for the field
Filter selected records by record ids
An array of sort objects that specifies how the records should be ordered.
An array of group objects that specifies how the records should be grouped.
An array of group ids that specifies which groups are collapsed
When provided, other query parameters will be merged with the saved ones.
If you want to get only some fields, pass in this parameter, otherwise all visible fields will be obtained
The parameter "ranges" is used to represent the coordinates [column, row][] of a selected range in a table.
Types of non-contiguous selections

prompt.description:

meta.description: The metadata of the field. The structure of the field's meta depend on the field's type. Currently formula and link fields have meta.
